RH8pN5RjrzfG-slK5Vm2AQ.text: La Favorita is probably one of the best pizza restaurants in Edinburgh, if not Scotland. Situated on Leith Walk where the old Caprice restaurant used to be, they have retained the famous wood fired oven, which makes the pizzas taste so fantastic.   The restaurant is very modern and funky for an Italian with a lively atmosphere and very helpful staff. Prices in La Favorita are a little more than you'd normally pay in an Italian, but it's definitely worth it.   They have a large choice of drinks on offer, with a good selection of Italian beers and wines. The pizza toppings are absolutely divine and are served fresh from the oven for that stone baked taste. I've never managed a pudding here, as i've always been too full, but they certainly look to be as good the rest of the food!

oZuPewQGg76XGFqdnK3_lQ.text: Not quite as good as previous reviews made out. Maybe I chose badly but my pizza was thicker and less crisp than I expected. THe topping was adequate not great.   Everything was alright - just not great. Waiting staff were very friendly.

_vyjxHCfh-fG9E_Kf3UAbw.text: This is a great restaurant.  Lovely italian food. Amazing Gluten free option available! They have clowns at the weekend for children and has a lovely relaxed atmosphere and fantastic service. I would highly recommend it for all the family. A really friendly place.

jrZNDYfzYQAkTS2KAMW9kg.text: Authentic, Italian pizza: mumma mia, it's good! Step into La Favorita and, believe me, you'll experience precisely why it is one of Edinburgh's most highly regarded restaurants.   Winner of numerous awards for its outstanding, stone oven baked pizzas, one can not be anything other than impressed by the quality of the food produced at this traditional, Italian pizza-house. The sheer size and variety of pizzas on offer is mouth-watering - it leaves a sumptuous taste in one's mouth.   Affordable prices and friendly staff add to a fantastic dining experience. I would certainly not hesitate to go back.

IXfZBYOckw4Dar67m4W5rg.text: Living just around the corner i've been here a number of times for both sit in meals and take away. The menu is a brilliant range of authentic italian pastas and pizzas. Favourites of mine are the gnocchi bolognese, potato and spinach pizza and especially the steak pizza. A friend i took here for the first time said it was the best pizza he's had in his 8 years in edinburgh and i'd have to agree.

sNFmCo63D_hp8KPa5tnreA.text: Have been there for my recent birthday, 5 people, and I must say everyone there was so charming and nice.  Had Tiramisu first, absolutely lovely, my friends had amazing cocktails.  Pizza was the best I ever had in Britain, like Italy.  special recommendation : Peroni riserva beer.  Highly recommended!!!

Kp28OSeh4-Fa9tyxbMKf3w.text: The best italian pizza you can find in Edinburgh is at La Favorita.  Nice place for dinner and you can have pizza/pasta take away as well.

K_Jc-5CpO-FacF7s8VQWpA.text: Great place to eat out. A lovely, vibrantly decorated place that creates a great atmosphere.  The menu is extensive and its hard to choose what you would like, I have been a few times and I think the Carbonara is my favourite! It is all well priced with main meals about 7-8 and it has some great sidesd for just a few pounds each.  The staff are great, if not a bit loud but it all jsut adds to the atmosphere of the place!

vxuYE9i__p-voypjU3eeZQ.text: La Favorita is a fantastic restaurant.   The pizza is amazing and is cooked using a traditional wood fired oven. The ice cream is pretty good too!!   The prices are reasonable and the staff are very approachable and helpful. They also cater for children.

aaOdbrf2Ouped9ZSqFCHsQ.text: The best pizzas you will find outside of Italy. They have a very good selection to choose from, whether you are in the restaurant or getting takeaway, and prices aren't too expensive. Also a good pasta menu to choose from, although with such an extensive menu and can be difficult to pick which dish you want most! Service has always been good when I have been there, and there traditional italian deserts are amazing. La Favorita is definitely worth a visit if you are in the area, but you will likely need to book, it is often busy.

7A_8qPr5eQyqER04uf0S7Q.text: When I moved to Leith the thing I was most excited about was being able to order pizza from La Favorita. The five cheese pizza is absolutely to kill and die for.

eGSmbLO8N_8zIcb6MsON8w.text: Been here a few times and have always left happy. Great stone baked pizza and some fantastic steak dishes.

Ln-DekzorfGlCihD3zYIHw.text: Great place for pizza although sit in is much better than takeaway as real Italian pizza doesn't keep in cardboard boxes unlike that which you might get from Dominos. It's far tastier though.   Watch out as unless the menu specifies a omato sauce on the pizza, it will not have one. Its caught people out before. Some of the cheese only pizzas are really nice though especially with ham and artichoke with a garlic butter.   Excellent place to take people with gluten intolerance as they make their own gluten free pizzas an they taste as good as the real thing.   I recommend if you do sit in, you enter through the left hand takeaway door and grab a menu - they often have vouchers for free drinks in them for restaurant meals.

Ld9ok8ozmp7FfDr2AuTaPQ.text: I went to dinner here solely based on the look of the front of the restaurant and the fact that it always seems busy. And, I was pleased. It has a large menu of gourmet pizzas, pasta dishes and some great house specialties (mostly fish). The staff was nice, though they do overdue the Italian bit. The food was excellent and not highly priced. This is definitely a restaurant worth going back to.

WNnqWSg4MeVYPvi3n5n0IQ.text: Fantastic Pizza and pasta, good value for money. Gets busy so book ahead if your heart is set!

BpvPOOlwc0X7ptz6H2Flaw.text: This place was amazing! If you're sitting in defintiely go for the mixed platter for a starter, its such great value! you may not need to order a main though- I'm usually a big eater, but with that to share for a starter, we ended up taking our mains home in boxes for the next nights dinner. Also helps that the food tastes fabulous too!

xjJLotrMHqp-Zzmfm4SnzQ.text: Well worth the effort of getting to this place (bit of a walk towards Leith) Superb pizzas, good portion and very tasty and not too expensive. Great atmosphere, very full ( always good sign!) great staff full marks

xT3APshdfSMEvXiogWP-SQ.text: We've been here a couple of times and have thoroughly enjoyed it. The wood-fired oven means fantastic-tasting pizzas with a perfect crispy base. Although it might be a little more expensive than other places, they more than make up with the quality and quantity of food. It's a good place to have a party as well - I went with a group from work and we had a good room at the back. If you go, treat yourself to the tasty antipasti platter!

ix9rMPVkGxEUKmcEziXQnw.text: Went there on Saturday evening for a birthday treat. The staff were very good telling us that the starters were generous and we might struggle but unfortunately failed to point out that what I had ordered for both courses was essentially the same thing, Fiocchetti Vegetariano and Calzone Vegetariano. The starter was very nice containing a good mix of vegetables but the calzone was mostly cheese and ended up being a bit of a struggle to finish. Service was good during the meal despite the place being very busy. Everyone else had log fired pizzas with a variety of toppings which they seemed to enjoy. Not in a hurry to go back but I'll order risotto the next time I think.

EtYNbb9qOHifurnI_M63_Q.text: I love La Faborita for their pizzas, they are absolutely massive. It isn't very cheap, but its definitely worth the money. Its a nice relaxed atmosphere and they have every topping you can think off, and lots of unusual things for the more adventurous. Highly recommended.

dlWVkqpaY5wPyEmPajcOmA.text: La Favorita well deserves the high ratings. I have to admit most of the time we order our La Favorita pizzas home, rather than eat there. Their home delivery service is quite smooth and fast. I love the fact that they include parmesan shavings with your order.  There is a large menu of pizzas to choose from. I still haven't tried most of them, because we love the few ones we've tried so far, and keep ordering them:)  As far as I know, La Favorita is part of the Vittoria Group that operates a few other Italian restaurants in Edinburgh. I've been to Vittoria Leith and Taste of Italy and like them as well.

sRv5_jQ-cSql05NDRwOI6w.text: Today was my birthday, my hubby and I went for a meal in La favorita , and it was great , The food was sensational :D the Pizza mare blue was great , and we also had the veal milanese and torre di pollo ! and both dishes were fab! :) The staff were energetic and had a real italian flavor to them lol :) I totally recommend it , It isn't the cheapest but i say it is worth every pence :D YUMM I can still taste the pasta that came with my chicken :)

N0D6X2Unb0reHVDJnkUvcw.text: The best pizza restaurant and Italian delivery service in Edinburgh can be found here. Always busy for that reason and booking is a must. Calzone Amalfitana for me please! Wash it down with a Peroni or a nice Chianti. Nice for a couple and group visits as we have done on many occaisions. Love it, love it..

fs7QhcX3OkPT8DwXtr_Lsg.text: Wow where to start?? This has to be the best Italian restaurant in Edinburgh!!   Having been around for so long and located down in Leith Walk it can be easily missed or written off by those not in the know! However for those who like their fresh Italian food this place is a must! It's really tastefully and colourfully decorated and it's bigger than it looks from the front.   The staff are always really friendly in a very Italian way! They all know the menu well and are happy to help you through the fantastic and varied menu (and everything can also be made gluten free!!).. All of the food is so fresh and so makes choosing difficult! If pizza if your thing then this is pizza heaven! The base is sooo good, thin and crispy but with a bit of bite cooked in a woodfired oven! The choice is just right and the toppings are so fresh and plentiful - being a spicey girl I'd recommend the Vesuvio every time! To make things even better they also make their own special recipe gluten free pizzas - which are just to DIE for!! And it wouldn't be a good italian dinner without a nice glass of vino and the drinks menu is fantasic, from classic aperitivos, great range of wines (in full and half bottle sizes) to after dinner liquers they have everything to accompany and compliment a fantastic lunch or dinner!  If you have kids then they will love it and it definately wont break the bank!! At roughly 10 for pizza it's great value for money and for every adult eating from the main menu kids eats for 1... Fantastic value!!!

X9nvGx8ehltrwt99pVbVGg.text: Like I've said before, If it's Italian, I'm in, and La Favorita has got some pretty great reviews on here so I felt it was my duty to visit and sample the fare.  It's owned (I think) by the same people as the Vittoria restaurant up the road which was fab when I visited, so I expected big things. It's a bit more laid back than Vittoria, so I really liked that vibe, which was great because myself and three friends went here for a wee lunchtime catch-up and had lots of time and space to sit and sip some wine, just chatting.  We booked a table and I'm glad we did because it was mobbed. I couldn't decide what to have so the waiter recommended a couple of things to me and I started with the Arancini, balls of mozzarella, mince and tomatoes rolled in breadcrumbs and deep fried, served with a dipping sauce, and they were absolutely brilliant! The best I have had so far anywhere, by a mile. I went for the broccoli and chicken pasta for my main which was to die for. Honestly, I could eat this every day and not get bored, just my kind of meal.   We had a couple of glasses of wine and left around 2 hours later which was quite lesuirely for a Friday lunchtime, but no-one rushed us, infact, quite the opposite. I would say this place is as good as, if not a teeny bit better than, Vittoria. Top Marks!

photos.caption: Photo of La Favorita - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

U8EDs78RzVkonOn89u9Kow.text: Best pizzas in Edinburgh bar none The restaurant has been given a Total Refurbrishment no expense spared Great Pizzas & More, Staff so very friendly,customer service excellent, This is the Home of Log Fired Pizzas.

3cCKJ9pafz8JQj80fjpeFA.text: The best way to describe this pizzeria is as one of the best-kept secrets of Edinburgh. I mean, apart from the obvious 'delicious!' 'amazing!' 'mouth-watering!' descriptions. Though all of these apply. It's a bit of trek if you're not a Leith-Walk-er (that was bad, I apologise profusely), but it's well worth the trek.   I went there with a friend who'd just moved to Leith and decided that he had to find his local haunts. He'd heard on the very very quiet grapevine that you couldn't really get better than this, so we headed there not knowing what to expect. And, I promise, this restaurant done good by us.   I ordered the special which was a pizza with ricotta and rocket and other perfect ingredients all put together, and my friend ordered the Vesuvio (a mountain of meat, really). The staff were all quick and gracious. The only downside, I'd have to point out, is the lack of beer on tap. I mean, there's one. And it's a good one, but it's a light lager and I'm an ale-girl.   Definitely worth your while, and though you'll spend about 10 quid a person, you'll have enough food for a couple of days.

5xo2aXdzlve3-v6_If4sCA.text: Tasty Pizza!!! Simple thin crust, with fresh ingredients. We ordered a margarita pizza and added pepperoni with ham.  I haven't tasted a pizza lie this since I was in Rome.

Vosr3MegaMJYw3Gc0pJCFg.text: You know what kids love most  unhealthy food. And pizza is in the top 5! My two little devils adore this place. We come here on every occasion. The atmosphere is great for families with kids. The staff is friendly and communicative, always asking if everything is okay. They really take care of their clients. We appreciate this!

OgofChJaAy18y_9LXyG0Rw.text: Without a doubt some of the best pizza you can get outside of Italy. An amazing range of toppings - check out the Favorita, topped with salmon, prawns, capers and just a little caviar. Starters are also outstanding, though be warned they can be quite substantial and are perhaps better shared than consumed alone. Still, in these days of restaurant portions that would barely fill a hamster let alone a fully grown man, it's quite refreshing to have too much instead of too little.   Service and decor are superb.   I would be very happy to go again and again, and you can't give a higher complement than that.

X18eqxIypeSywbkngP6Zhw.text: I've gotta say upfront, la favorita is my favourite place to go for pizza, and their delivery is dirt cheap (and pretty fast too)   Their starters are pretty tasty (and massive) Their pasta dishes didn't really blow me away so much (again pretty hefty portions) but the Pizza is sublime. I exspecially recommend the Vesuvio, is a demon of a pizza! The deserts too do not disappoint, the ice cream was served just at the right temperature with lovely sauces, the panna cotta too is definitely worth trying, a lovely soft vanilla mixes so well with the strong caramel sauce.   It might seem pricey on the menu but the portions are pretty sizable, and the staff are happy to box things up for you to take home (their pizza is uber++ good if you're hungover)   always worth a visit, nice toilets, unoffensive music, friendly staff, good atmosphere :)

pusm14f5tAdjrIctQRnxJg.text: Easily the best Pizza to be found in Edinburgh, the stone oven cooked Pizzas are taste as good as any I've had in Italy.   The place is very child friendly where the staff make you feel like your children brighten their working day rather than a chore to serve.

uToNdwGfUT13_kTGaItYXQ.text: La Favorita is a fantastic restaurant and has a fabulous atmosphere.   The pizza here is amazing and is cooked in the city's only traditional wood fired oven. The prices are a little steep but nothing too excluding, staff are very helpful and friendly. My only critique is that when busy it is very, very noisy - so if you have a headache, best opt for takeaway!   Ess

zPWqf_-UaF6lh3frD7LNVw.text: We love the online ordering and delivery service! Delicious pizza/pasta and desserts!

eSvx3tWN0nLsZI6_MN9-XQ.text: I was seriously craving pizza and La Favorita was just down the street from Victoria. A pretty cool pub on Leith Walk where we were having drinks. We ordered 3 pizzas but 2 would have been plenty. They were fantastic. I hope to go there once more before leaving Edinburgh.

WLcO9U3avqDYKr7SBtOqpg.text: Superb pizza and service. Great menu. Decent wine list. Super place to take kids. It's a little pricey but worth it for pizza this good.

wfkQXcJQh1NJX2UXcMwi0A.text: La Favorita is a festival of Italian tastes. The contemporary chic interior stirs up feelings of space and style while dramatic lighting and decor set the scene. The lively atmosphere buzzes with music and friendly waiters that would seemingly hug you if given half the chance.   Pizza and pasta are transformed to gourmet dishes and are bursting with colour and flavour. The portions are reasonable and are money well spent. The desserts are heaven on a plate and thus make it difficult to decide on just one!

Pi4fLCbC4v4ypd3vgqOvPw.text: Family friendly Italian restaurant. Not the cheapest place to eat, but great food. Pizzas are very good, especially calzone. Bright clean decor, always lots of covers, friendly staff. Their takeaway menu is good, just about any combination of pizza toppings to be had, plus a nice selection of pasta dishes and italian bread.

5GkGPUvX9__pNFPdSlgoyw.text: We really like favorita pizzas and they do a good range of gluten free pizzas too. Best news is that they now deliver - you can create an account on line and order up your favorite one.   Worth a visit if you are in the Leith area, restaurant is nice and friendly. Good family place - although avoid Sunday afternoon if you don't have kids (Mr Stevie the Clown wasn't my idea of good entertainment).

f_M4cnT8Aa8h5-1BkvbVow.text: Fantastic fresh Italian pizza and pasta.   A lovely experience of Italian food. The decor is very modern and the staff are always up for a laugh.   The Christmas menu is very good value ana although you can opt for a traditional Christmas meal if desired there are interesting alternatives on offer too.   Easy location to reach.

d_h80xa13aYet2-bYd-Dkg.text: Hmmm I am American and I grew up in the NYC area, so I am fairly confident that I know good Italian food when I taste it.  I am not saying that the food isn't good, but it definitely did not blow me away.  We came here because it was listed as a Top 10 Best Restaurant in Edinburgh, according to The Guardian and I definitely would not rate this in my top 10.  However, with that being said, the service was fantastic.  Our servers were all very friendly and attentive.  The portions here are enormous and we did feel that they mislead us into ordering more food than we needed because we did ask if the starters were big enough to shared and they recommended that we order two.  Both plates were huge and we certainly could have just shared one between the two of us.  Not to mention the entrees were enough for 2-3 people to share.  So come hungry!  Ambiance has a little bit of a corny feel but also reminded me a lot of any Italian spot in suburban New York / New Jersey, in the sense that there was Frank Sinatra playing in the background the entire time and the servers were a little over the top trying to prove their Italian-ness (actual, and not the macho mobster Guido kind we see over here in the States).

_36L1yHRNP_s8xeeM_5m-Q.text: I've been here  few times and I always enjoy my visit.   The staff are lovely and helpful. The menu is extensive. The food is delicious with massive portions. The price is alright, not cheap but not breaking the bank. The desserts are lovely.   If you haven't had La Favorita yet, get there and find out why people love it so much for yourself!

untSG4K4JWlgo3LsbHmQZw.text: This is theeee place for pizza. There is nowhere better in Scotland, end of. If you don't like their pizza's, well I'm afraid you don't like pizza.  La Favorita's pizzas are made fresh to order in the traditional way, using a real wood fired oven, hand stretched, not too thin, with tasty, fresh toppings and real mozzarella cheese.  One pizza is more than enough to satisfy the hungriest of appetites, but if you dare go for the antipasto platter you'll be blown away with the quality and amount of produce they cram onto the plate.  The staff are friendly and attentive and anywhere that is worth a round trip from Glasgow, just for pizza, is worth 5 stars.

iYJe_5Ois38Pqu01Y-XfcQ.text: Very good friendly engaging service.  Our starters of porcini & ricotta ravioli and grilled scallops & king prawns were excellent.  We had sirloin with marsala sauce and rolled fillets of sole with asparagus.  The only snag was that the steak could have been a bit more flavoursome.  The green salad was a let down - the balsamic dressing was way too gloopy.  All in all I will return... definitely want to try their pizza and more of their pasta.

photos.caption: Photo of La Favorita - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. fillets of sole rolls with asparagus inside
Photo of La Favorita - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. procini and ricotta ravioli
Photo of La Favorita - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. grilled scallops and king prawns

iNaGNZvBchCtm-XpyFTJIg.text: Pizza in Edinburgh = La Favorita.   Simple as that.   It's authentic Italian pizza mind, so if you're after an americanised slopfest of stodge, well, best go elsewhere. If you want a pizza that's every bit as good as one you'd get in Italy, this is the only place to go.   So often in Edinburgh, authenticity comes at a premium price... not here. Even using a discount card Dominos is more expensive and infinitely more crap.   We no longer order pizza, we order a Favorita. It really is synonymous with pizza in our household.

sQ9IUnFnDfpcpIaYTQE3mA.text: Greeted with "Buona sera signorina", the sound of accordion background music, and an array of ice cream flavours as I walked through the door of La Favorita, I was instantly cheered out of my lethargic state. Not least because the twinkly-eyed waiter called me "young lady" - this kind of complimentary talk earns anyone an instant tip as far as I'm concerned. This eatery is the kind of classic, traditional Italian experience which has to produce at least a smile from visitors, even if you've had the worst day at work ever/been dumped/dropped your favourite ornament/are a generally grumpy individual.  I opted for the Risotto Imperiale, a tasty, well presented, affair, which came with jumbo, juicy prawns and a langoustine with one claw perched on top of a generous portion of rice and champagne sauce. My very critical fellow diner, definitely a pizza enthusiast, went for the Pizza ai due Salami, which after a few minutes of careful munching he announced was "very good", definitely high praise for him, before continuing to devour the rest of his meal, (only offering me a small slither).  La Favorita has a pretty extensive menu, with all the dishes on offer you would expect from an Italian restaurant, so if you've got a craving for decent pasta and pizza somewhere different, where you're not paying over the odds, take a wander away from the centre of town and get down to Leith Walk.

photos.caption: Photo of La Favorita - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Photo from la-favorita.com.

vE4caNkxqQYcE28Fu84MhA.text: I can promise you that if I never eat another meal, the memory of the meal I had tonight at La Favorita will keep me satisfied.   We flew from London to Edinburgh today and so many things went wonky. By the time we got to the hotel, it had been almost twelve hours since I had eaten. I was starving. I am also allergic to wheat. This means that finding a restaurant can be tricky. The hotel staff (reviewed elsewhere) was on it. They got us a cab and sent us on our way to this gem.  I never would have gone for Italian food in Scotland on my own because, hey, I'm in Scotland. Let's eat Scottish food. I am so glad I did, though.  Our server, at table ten, was charming, friendly, and helpful. He definitely made the evening a delightful experience.  We started with the vegetarian antipasto, which contained some of my most favorite foods: zucchini, eggplant, hummus, and artichoke hearts. It was fantastic.  For my main course I had the duck risotto. I am not typically a fan of rice-based main courses. But I love duck and all o the other things listed on this item. It was literally the best food that has ever passed these lips. The duck was so tender and juicy and the rice was so full of all the flavors. It is served in a bowl made of parmesan which lends just the right amount of flavor to the rice.   My husband ordered a steak with figs. He enjoyed, though he is a man of few words (hey, only one of us can be chatty!) and had little else to say on the topic.   We wanted dessert, but there was no room.   Seriously, if you're in Edinburgh, eat here!

hBM0qGOBYPYZbW6Dg_hYjg.text: amazing pizza! I got the mozzarella and parma ham spedini appetizer and it was so good. I would definitely come back

Z9WQY_i3oJ0EnW8g1Oin4g.text: It had been a while since my last visit, but the quality doesn't seem to have diminished in the intervening period. As far as we can see, this remains the best pizz place in the city.  Overall, we said: "La Favorita served us really nicely, and restored our sense of wellbeing in no small measure. Although we haven't sampled from all the leading pizza places in Edinburgh, yet, I'm happy that this place is still serving a quality product, so would be happy to recommend it to anyone looking for top-notch pizza."

hupc8tyvfu7Se0-u1l6Q7w.text: This might be the best early evening eating spot on Leith Walk when the sun shines. Go there on a warm afternoon and order an Italian draft beer (I think it was Peroni we had) - it's ice cold and quite the most refreshing thing.  The plate of vegetarian antipasti was epic - and delicious - and the pizza (one to share between two was more than enough after our starter) really tasty. We sat outside, in warm sunshine, watching life go by on Leith Walk - we could have been in Italy. Almost.  Really friendly waiters with proper Italian accents who said hello to Fergus and brought him a big bowl of water - much appreciated.

S_XF_FdE0ROObgA9bWD8UQ.text: This place has quietly become outstanding for food and service. Went on a very busy Thursday night and though we had to wait to be seated (in spite of having booked), it was worth the 5 minutes wait. Simply fantastic antipasti, pasta, pizza and dessert. Very reasonably priced food, drinks and impeccable service by people who know exactly what they are doing. Great kid's menu too. A must for real, family-style Italian.

knf-gENlhTmMZwEi182bEg.text: Excellent service & practically zero waiting time between placing the order and it landing on the table. The Vesuvio is not as hot as it's name would suggest and the secondary waiter station placing is potentially inconvenient but otherwise you'd be hard pressed to find anything wrong here. I look forward to going back and actually managing to try the tempting sounding cheese board.

pYY5ZiEPaR9YrHc7dxYa0Q.text: Consistently excellent food, good service and good location. Only downside, it's so loud!  The tiled floor combined with the many diners makes it uncomfortably loud. Purely based on the food however, definitely worth a visit.

vbm3UDxIyuyImrQFD31dOA.text: No matter how hard I try I really struggle to find something wrong with La Favorita. I go to the restaurant - food is great, service amazing, brilliant, vibrant atmosphere; I order on line - delivery always on time, quality of food great. If anyone is looking for a good Italian cuisine, friendly service, decent prices then La Favorita is your choice.

kvDD5xVEIhfFSKpiE0kpOQ.text: Went here for a family meal in Edinburgh. OK is about as good as I can go - service is friendly but bordering on the cheesy. Main gripe was with the food - it was all a bit bland and overcooked. We went for antipasti and secondi rather than pizza and I suspect that was our error as the pizzas looked excellent. We had two veal milanese that were both thick pieces of veal on the bone breaded and fried - and bland and overcooked. Also a piece of very dry swordfish cooked in similar style (despite a request for very rare) and an underseasoned seafood pasta dish (faggottini)?  Ended up with icecream (chocolate was great) and the five of us were out into the Edinburgh rain 200 quid lighter (we had 2 bottles of the strongly recommended wine).  Was it a bad meal? No not really, but just a bit underwhelming and expensive. Shame - if I go back I'll be sure to order the pizza as that looks great...

mNFwSnyB-fo5RYm6bX2FAw.text: If you want a traditional, Italian style pizza then check out La Favorita.    However, I like my pizza thick, doughy with cheese dripping off the sides so was not at all enamoured with this restaurant.  I thought that it was very expensive considering the sheer lack of topping and the portion sizes of pastas also aren't up to scratch.    Each to their own I guess but give me Papa John's anyday.

PjCFtOaUfJuo-H2keOi3pQ.text: PESCATORA. PESCATORA. PESCATORA.   seriously, if you like seafood, DO IT. i'm going to put this out there and admit that for most of my life, i haven't been a pizza fan. this is perhaps surprising, since i am half italian. la favorita really has changed that. their pescatora (and other!) pizza is just AMAZING. it has no cheese, and melted cheese might be my problem with pizza, but it is just so so amazing. and i like all the other pizza's i have sampled from here too.   both take away and sit in are just as good, depending on your mood! the waiters are fun, friendly, and typically italian ;) highly recommended!

I9PZRANqMfDK8p2wZnF9Tg.text: La Favorita has created a sense of dischord in my household. On one hand, I loved the vegetarian antipasti - a massive pile of vegetables and cheese (the chickpea puree was delicious!) that would overwhelm one person, no matter how hungry they were. I also loved my pizza - thin base, log fired Favorita (smoked salmon, fat juicy capers, caviar and shrimp with a generous squeeze of lemon) - in my cold-addled state, every flavour pierced the fug and excited the senses. It was such a pleasure to eat a pizza that didn't disappoint for a change.   On the other hand, while the boy equally enjoyed the starter, he was less enamoured with his tomato-less De Leone - bresaola, radicchio and rocket was not a winning combination for him. Our debate around La Favorita became quite heated as a result! But we will be back, and next time he'll be testing out a pizza more to his liking.

SVMpEtK52cppVgJSu53KbA.text: La Favorita has fast become a firm favorita with me! Passed by the restaurant on the Leith Walk (about 15 minute walk from the city centre) and feeling peckish decided to give it a go.  We were given a nice, clean table and the waiter instantly made us feel very welcome with his lively patter and infectious good cheer. The menu is very reasonably priced with a wide variety of options for every palate. As a vegetarian, I often struggle due to menu limitations so was pleased to find a lot of different pasta and pizza options. The starters and desserts are also noteworthy with their mouthwatering tastiness and budget-friendly prices. Better still, La Favorita does home delivery! An infinity times better than the usual run-of-the-mill cardboard junk. Definitely give the place a go if you're local, you won't regret it

7rfKeKQKuoUzxcqlTscJTw.text: Yum, Yum, Yum, Yum, Yum.   La Favorita is the best pizza place in Edinburgh, full stop. The pizzas are all authentic Italian, cooked in log fired pizza cookers and are absolutely delicious. Above all that they are cheap as chips. The quality is amazing for the price you pay and in reality I'd happily pay more. 6 for a Marinara!! 10 for the Vesuvio and something like 12 for a pizza that has sirloin steak on it! The place is just such amazing value for money.   The fact all their pizzas are available to order as take away and delivery should really put Domino's and Pizza Hut out of business. How anyone can pay for the other two brands (and all the other pizza delivery places in the city) is just scandalous.   Whether you are sitting in or taking away, this place is a gem. If you're sitting in I'd recommend the bruschetta or mozzarella wrapped in Parma ham as starters and get some of their lovely Italian Ice-Cream for desert.   Edinburgh's number one pizza, bar none. PICK UP THE PHONE!

wqQe_q19AR6ji7Jx-St7pA.text: Fantastic upscale Italian restaurant with great pizza and main dishes. I ordered the prawn stuffed sea bass and it was fantastic. Also, you can't go wrong with the bruschetta with mushrooms and truffle oil.   Simply a great experience overall with great food and service.

8Rb3A5zn-RaQBI8QIIRlYA.text: Got some pizzas delivered and they were quite tasty with a nice thin crust.  Everyone in our group seemed pleased.

lU7OXSv2IWN8drKY3cjZ7w.text: The best gluten-free pizza and pasta I have ever had. Their customer service is amazing too, and they are very knowledgeable about cross-contamination. I've never had a gluten reaction from them (I have coeliac), and am assured each time I order delivery, because they put a special sticker on anything that is gluten-free.   Their delivery is also amazing, having never been even 2 minutes late!  Seriously, can't say enough good things.

c9SoVYRlfgVUi4fqcsS_Bg.text: This is definitely my favourite pizza place in Scotland!  I miss it so much since moving to Glasgow but visited again recently went through in Edinburgh seeing friends.  It's still as good as I remember - I had the 5 cheese pizza (but with added chicken, my favourite pizza topping) and LOVED it - such a good combo of cheeses, tasty blue, salty pecorino, stringy mozzarella...  I can't remember the others now but it was delish!  I used to always get the Zia Rosa (chicken and peppers with cherry tomatoes but am glad I tried another - they're both fab!)  The wedges were nice too but would have been better if crispy and with a bit more parmesan, I liked the truffle oil though.  I like the decor and the staff are always very friendly and efficient.  They even used to deliver to me in Slateford when I lived there, despite it being completely the other side of town!  :)

photos.caption: Photo of La Favorita - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of La Favorita - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of La Favorita - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

hrLRkkilEV0jdFb6_Oz_Dw.text: Yum! Perhaps not the best pizza out there, but one hell of a fine option if you're in Leith.  The lunch specials are where La Favorita shines on quality and price. 8.95 nets you a main and drink, or 11.95 with a dessert. The pizzas are large enough to satiate a full appetite, or even to be split if you only have the munchies.  The mushrooms on their pizzas are the perfect kind; small and flavorful and a perfect compliment to the pepperoni. With some chili oil you've got proper flavor in abundance!

photos.caption: Photo of La Favorita - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Colorful seats!
Photo of La Favorita - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Back dining area
Photo of La Favorita - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Strawberry panna cotta

UkJi70YwiRHZX8VyeUoarw.text: Hold up, another review for La Favorita's delivery service (and a good one at that).  Now, they warn you that if you're booking at a busy time (Friday/Saturday evening, for example) that your order could take up to 90 minutes, so pre-booking is advised.  I've fallen prey to this mistake before (the mistake of not ordering in advance) but I can't say I wasn't warned.  Last night, however, our pizza was delivered very quickly, so 6pm on Sundays mustn't be peak times!  Anyway. We like to order a pizza and a pasta to share, and the best day of the week to do this is on a Tuesday as like every other pizza chain and its dog, they do a deal on a Tuesday. But just to be different, it's not a 2 for 1, instead it's order a full price pizza and get a pasta for 1, which given the pizzas are several pounds cheaper than Dominos et al, is definitely a good deal.  But do you know what's a better deal? The desserts. You can order two for 6.50, and if you've got a sweet tooth you should definitely avail yourself of this. But don't just order any pudding, order the profiteroles. Why? Because there are two sizes of profiteroles (7 and 10) and both are included in the deal. Which is insane, as ordering 10 profiteroles by themselves costs 7.95. And yet you can get 20 for 6.50. I've now got lots of profiteroles in my fridge. Did I  mention they're salted caramel ones too?..... I'm drooling on my keyboard!  Oh yeah. and the pizzas are great! Proper, authentically Italian tasting pizzas, with gluten free bases available.  I'm normally a pepperoni girl, but La Favorita inspires me to try something different, and I've yet to go wrong. The pastas are decent, I did really like the vegetable lasagna but that is no longer on the delivery menu, so last night it was normal meat ragu lasagna, which was tasty. Not the best I've ever had, but decent.  I've actually only eaten in once, a while ago, but from what I remember service was friendly and prompt, and we had a great time drinking wine and eating pizzas in the sun.  Like any takeaway, if you're ordering lots then it'll be pricey, but if you're savvy and you get deal happy, you'll come away with a tasty meal and won't feel like you've broken the bank.

yM9RdooLfmx9kdM_PtGgLQ.text: I'm giving 3 stars because of the fantastic service and delicious gin moitito! The food however disappointed. My all time favourite of a seafood pizza was soggy, slightly uncooked and simply not the same. Like I said this pizza was my favourite, sadly not anymore.  I'll need to look elsewhere now.

6DAEYI48LPCxtLomwOHlGQ.text: I'm going to have to add another shining review to La Favorita's already gleaming Yelp page. But, man, those pizzas!  Fresh, seasoned to perfection, generous in toppings; delicious, delicious, delicious. I really don't think I've had a pizza that's bowled me over like La Favorita's. This, my pizza-loving friends, is the pizza of dreams. And the fuss, it's all well-deserved.  La Favorita is a flashy affair. As you walk into the restaurant, you'll pass the swish open kitchen. Efficient and fast; churning out pizza after pizza. There's a genuine camaraderie between staff, and we received an enviably warm welcome. It's all go. And the smell of classic Italian flavours looms in the air. Just catching sight of the dishes making their way from kitchen to table had me drooling. I couldn't wait to have myself one of La Favorita's acclaimed pizzas.  The Nduja (mozzarella, italian sausage, spinach, nduja & red onion) and the Ventricina (mozzarella, premium spicy salami Ventricina, chicken breast, peppers, red & green chillies) did not disappoint. Not one bit.   Service, for the most part, is smooth. - Waiters are animated and energetic, adorning braces and friendly grins. Other than some trouble in catching our waiter for the bill, we were definitely well attended to.   La Favorita's just perfect for a special occasion. - During our visit for dinner, the lights were turned right down as the tune of 'happy birthday' rang out. This, of course, didn't bother us, but I imagine that on a night of several birthdays, it might be a little distracting considering just how dark it got. Nonetheless, nothing could distract from just how good the pizzas were.  Italian in Edinburgh? La Favorita is foolproof!

tM5OUgFNK5z4lVlP2j0m-g.text: La Favorita is one of the very best Italian restaurants in Edinburgh. The food is excellent (big portions too) and the staff are relaxed and extremely helpful. This family-run restaurant has a fantastic family-friendly atmosphere. Consistently excellent.

gmPL5lqZuifV3Xt7zUkurQ.text: This place had decent pizzas, however I wasn't blown away for a place that is said to be the best in Scotland. They got one of our group's pizzas wrong but all in all it was a good meal. I think the anticipation due to its reputation gave us an unrealistic expectation of our meal prior to dining there. However! The Ice cream is really good! they do an Ice cream/sorbet mix on a few flavours and my favourite was the Apricot!

jIXwf0cecA5rz2-Tnpdd3g.text: Whenever I see 'wood-fired'  or 'log-fired' to describe a pizza I get a bit worried that it's going to come out like a crispy tortilla wrap with toppings. I know it's probably horrendously untraditional and sacrilege of me,  but I like a bit of stodge to my pizzas. Our pizza here was a little crisped at the edge but the thin base was very soft and melt-in-the-mouth. We opted for the Vegetariana, replacing the mozzarella with dairyfree Italian rice cheese and omitting the mushrooms (my husband & I don't like mushrooms). As an aside,  I've just looked at the website menu again which lists the Vegetariana as having asparagus,  aubergine, sauteed carrots,  and sliced potatoes. Our menu had mushrooms,  aubergine,  and peppers.  It was 14" as standard so we split a pizza and a side of wedges.  We asked for wedges with no parmesan (usually not vegetarian,  as well as obviously not vegan) and they were nice. Not as fluffy as I prefer my chips to be, but they were a tasty accompaniment.   Service was fantastic,  and I felt the food arrived quite quickly. I look forward to their Glasgow branch opening soon!

photos.caption: Photo of La Favorita - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Potato wedges
Photo of La Favorita - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Pizza with Italian dairy-free cheese topping,  no BYO vegan cheese with them! :)

D1bgF6U2Lnixr2S9_ihm6Q.text: A little pricey, but haven't had a bad pizza here. You'd need at least 3 pizzas to feed 4 adults, btw.

Ji2IG93sFzG2o13JNuWtog.text: Oh, La Fav, La Fav, we are breaking up, and by the looks of things it's definitely not you, it's me.  I just - I just - I'm sorry. I don't get it. I'd love to give this an extra star just for the timely delivery and the polenta chips, which are great, but really, it wouldn't be representative: I have not found the experience as a whole A-OK. My three starses are chirpy. But I am currently sad and doleful. And it looks like this will be the very first two star review, so anybody reading this, please just assume I'm wrong, because I am so in the minority and I want La Fav to do well.  But anyway, I'm writing because it is my habit to do so. Here goes.  I heard such amazing things about La Fav's pizzas. They're the best in Edinburgh! They're astonishing! They're... really not... for me.   And to say that I'd sooner pay the extra couple of quid and get a pizza from a national chain is really upsetting for me, because I'd love to prefer somewhere local and non-chainy and freshly made and all that jazz.  And I tried. Really. I was super unimpressed with the first pizza I had delivered, which was a calzone. When it arrived, sure, it was big, but it was also completely wet and falling apart. It bled juice everywhere, was not all that warm, and was just - well, if *I* don't enjoy a pizza, something is wrong.  Anyway, I figured that that something that was wrong must be me, because the reviews continued to pour in. Hooray for La Fav! We love La Fav! Their pizzas rule pizzaland! So I tried again, a couple of months later. And, well, this one was not bad. It also wasn't all that good. I just felt it lacked flavour. It was - I can't believe I'm saying this about a pizza - boring. Not boring like simple-and-predictable-but-yummy-nonetheless. Just... eh. I paid all that for this? Here's the kicker. I. Didn't. Finish. It. A pizza. Me. ...Tears.  So there's my saga of twin woes. My chronicles of double disappointment. My tale of two pities. Have a great life, La Favorita. I wish you all the best. You will find someone who appreciates you for what you are.

V9FJSouDw-UCym9Rtwswig.text: La Favorita is hands down the best pizzeria in Edinburgh, perhaps in all of the UK.  It was my staple go-to pizza place when I lived in Edinburgh. Great crusts, wonderful flavours, fresh ingredients, terrific service, sit in or take away, and they sell Haagen-Dazs strawberry ice cream. I make special trips to have this pizza whenever I'm back in the UK. #worth5hrtrainride

a18B7ZEKbuQzvmLrtL2qzg.text: I love this pizza. It is best fresh and eaten at the restaurant! Delivery is offered and it is good, but because it is just so so much better fresh, I'd recommend just going there and eating. If you're getting take-away, it's just not going to be as hot and the ingredients that are meant to be fresh (rocket/arugula, prosciutto) are going to be included in separate baggies for you to place on top when the pizza arrives. This is appreciated rather than having the prosciutto baked with the pizza, but it does mean that the presentation and "fresh out of the oven" factor will be lost when ordering this for delivery. But it is fantastic pizza! Go!

kYUPE6eSpG8V4pX2EdcTJw.text: So I have to say this is based purely on delivery from their Mornignside branch.  Pizza's have in the main been great, there does seem to be an issue with these thin bases - the pizzas almost every time have arrived cold or luke warm. With pizza I always have high expectations of hot umptious cheesy goodness.  Just hasnt hit the mark often enough for me. Side dishes have varied from ok to a disaster. Sent for delivery in boxes not fit for purpose. Not great!

ORRNZWNCaVAQoEkeFlFCww.text: It pains me to write that the pizza is likely the best in Edinburgh. It pains me to write this because there are so many things about this place that annoy me.  -1.50 delivery charge no matter how much you order.  -If they get something wrong they will always say 'we will send you out a voucher' - NEVER happens  -Always trying with the upsell when you eat in. I know that is the Italian brusque 'style' of service but come on - give it a break! I don't want to order your overpriced wine.  So to recap. Good for Edinburgh, if you are a tourist from a big city (hell, even a small city) in USA or even Europe you will find this place a bit lacking. We have a million pizza places and this is the best one but the comparison pales when removed from Edinburgh.   Neapolitan pizza, 00 flour, wood fired oven. Has all the hallmarks of a great place but misses just due to the fact there is no decent competition. I know that down the road there is another good pizza place but the culture is not alive in Edinburgh.  Get - pizza  Don't get - sold their expensive wine

5-Hi2YeplTWm2wSAZgmR4A.text: Used to LOVE this place. Please don't bother now  all dishes have changed (even when menu says they are the same ) soggy pizza salty pasta.

vYsvxqEB9rS7-jdS_vgmlQ.text: mmmm who doesn't love pizza???  i, for one, am a massive fan!!  and on sunday night after a day being rather lazy and sloth like, i could think of only one way to end the weekend right... going for some log fired pizzas from my local pizzeria, la favourita.  i'm one lucky girl that this place is literally less than a ten minute walk from my flat and that my boyfriend was more than happy to agree that we should visit before he dropped me off at my flat.  on arrival we were warmly welcomed and shown to a good sized table for two people.  one thing that i really love about this place is how nice and cheerful everyone who works here is!  i swear, these people don't ever frown, there is always a smile and such a warm welcoming customer experience :)  as we walked through, i got a good glimpse of the restaurant which is huge!!  although i've been here a handful of times before i never realised how big a space they actually have....loads of tables so definitely a good place for a large party of people!  on receiving the menu, i suddenly was overwhelmed with all the choices available!!  not only is there more than a dozen choices for pizza goodness, but they also have a special pizza each day to add to that.  being all about the pizza, we didn't bother with starters and went straight for the mains.  i was trying to decide between three options, one being a calzone, but in the end i went for the Capricciosa changing the ham for salami milano.  i'm a total sucker for pizzas with artichokes on them...yum!!!  the boy went for the Vesuvio to get a spicy kick with his dinner.  we also decided to share a green salad.  beers arrived (innis and gunn for me, i'm a total convert!) and we'd barely had our first sip before the pizzas were placed regally on our table!!  these pizzas were HUGE!!!  and so fresh with a nice crispy but also chewy crust mmmmmm.  the salami made an excellent addition to my pizza and each bite was a combination of fresh mozarella, flavourful tomato sauce,  fresh mushrooms, olives, aritchokes, and salty salami. just pizza heaven!!  the green salad was also super tasty and fresh with a good helping of lettuce, cucumbers, celery, and olives.  it had a tangy balsamic vingrette on it which i couldn't help but dip my pizza crusts in.  judging by our empty plates we were very happy with our meals!  but unfortunately there was no room left for dessert, although they have an awesome selection of gelato that i am looking forward to on another visit!  i also look forward to more delicious pizzas and friendly service!  so glad that la favourita is my loca pizza joint!!! :)

photos.caption: Photo of La Favorita - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

FeD7Tx2hXarkqDJmwoHacw.text: Definitely good pizza, and a variety of other Italian foods. However, the pizza came out a bit undercooked (dough was mushy in the centre and toppings were constantly sliding off). The atmosphere is great, and the staff were kind and very helpful. My opinion: ask for the pizza "well-done". Also, pasta is good, but a little too oily.

hZ_7RJyZ2gU2WMOcH08xlg.text: In Scotland with my running group to run the Edinburgh Half/Marathon, and we had our team dinner here.  We had 25 people in all!  The restaurant was already very crowded, and the place was tight with other customers waiting for tables.  Busy doesn't even begin to describe the environment, but the waitstaff couldn't have been nicer and more patient and polite, not only with each other but with all the people standing around, waiting to get in.  I was already very impressed!      As I said, we were 25 people, so we had a set menu with choices within that menu.  I started out with the bruschetta, and it was good, which was encouraging.  For my entree, I had the lasagna, and it was delicious!  As good or better than anything in the States, and I've eaten A LOT of Italian food in CA and NY.  It was just as good as the pasta I had in Italy!!!  For dessert I had the tiramisu, which I don't normally care for, but this was also delicious!  The cake part was light, and the custard part was fluffy, and the whole wasn't overly "watery" or soggy like some tiramisus can be when they "overdip" the cake.  Everyone else in our group enjoyed their choices, with most commenting on how good their food was!      Again, I can't emphasize how incredible the waitstaff were.  It is not easy to serve 25 people at one time with an already very busy restaurant, and they managed to not only serve us, but we were attended to with promptness and cheer.  I never felt like I was being a burden, never had to flag someone down to refill my water or get another drink, etc...  They were always one step ahead of us, and we wanted for nothing!  The service was excellent.   This was truly a wonderful dining experience, and I highly recommend this place!!!

Q_mZkdfMPdPz24GgGcO1-g.text: Pizza was cold. Lack of cheese on my order and was for a stone bake rather chewy. My Partner also said hers had little cheese and was hard in parts.  This was not worth the 30 paid for two even HAD it arrived hot.  Order made 10/09/19

cyiY89QSCBceq1Mckc6jXQ.text: I was desperate for a hot, carb-loaded dinner after landing in Edinburgh and thankfully La Favorita was right around the corner from my Airbnb and had great reviews on Yelp. I was happy to find an Italian restaurant in Scotland since I was looking for some comfort food.  The interior has lots of seating space in separate little rooms. It's all one connected space, but there are separators and barriers around the sections, if that makes sense. There's seating for larger and smaller groups, and I was immediately seated at a table by myself. The staff was very friendly.  I ordered the arancini and seasonal risotto. I told you, I wanted CARBS. The arancini was gooey and cheesy and fantastic and came with a spicy tomato salsa. The perfect appetizer. The risotto was divine! It came in a parmesan cheese crisp bowl and had a parm cheese base, pears mixed in, and balsamic vinegar drizzled on top with some arugula. Everything came together for one delicious, decadent meal. The portion was also huge and I had plenty left over for another meal.  My server and I talked about cats and I instantly felt welcomed in Edinburgh and at La Favorita. If you like Italian food, I definitely recommend hitting them up!

photos.caption: Photo of La Favorita - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Seasonal risotto special (parmesan, balsamic, pear)
Photo of La Favorita - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Arancini (cheese, rice, beef)

beL-i0dxK7nTHG3nuqbSrw.text: Chose them because of their good rating but should have known there was a problem when the phone answers "Are you calling about placing an order or about one that was already placed?" Check it out before hand and hear for yourself. When I called to check on the pizza I had gotten a text 30 minutes beforehand but still had not received the guy told me it did leave then but was still in its way??? 20 minutes later, still no pizza. I called to cancel the order and they told me that I would have to take it up with corporate two days later! Don't bother people, not worth the headache. Credit card company is having to get my money back because they didn't refund me

fHmFGd6GddgaZHXB2s-PUA.text: Never a more insipid pizza sauce. A comedy of errors in the fine details, topped off by  being undercooked (pizza), slow ( when the restaurant was no where near full) and  eventually  done in by an inattentive waitress, Keen to use Italian even when oddly out of place.

10SII03gHfQifr9UYq9y-w.text: Went here based on a recommendation from the concierge at our hotel.  The food was just ok but the service was terrible. Waitress was inattentive at best and the manager made the excuse that she didn't understand. The only bad meal I've had in Scotland.

FPOcdJ1_2WnBJOBgicM0_Q.text: We just got into Edinburgh an we're looking for a restaurant near the flat we rented.  The staff was very friendly and courteous. I had a shrimp and crab crepe. It had no flavor and they left the tails on the shrimp. It was in a cognac sauce which you would have thought made it very rich, it was not. I ordered a side salad which had no dressing on it. We also ordered an appetizers of bruschetta. This was the best part of the entire meal.

5DjvsZfKZlDu1J_8kyOMfQ.text: Had a terrible experience on an early afternoon, being myself the only client.   Pros: I asked for a pizza Primavera (Parma Ham as the main attraction) plus salami as an extra topping, and it came with plenty Parma Ham.  Cons: Front of House waitress Maria ignored me for two minutes as I was waiting to be seated in front of her (the pizza chef greeted me and realised that so he called her a couple of times)  I asked for Pizza Primavera plus salami, and repeated it twice to avoid any errors, but the waitress looked clueless as she doesn't comprehend the English language.   Got the Pizza Primavera...but guess what...no salami... I pointed that out to Maria but all she said was that it comes with Parma Ham... I told her that the salami topping I asked for as an extra was missing...to no avail.  Got the bill and guess what...the  2 extra topping was included... Asked to get that removed but she was still unsure what extra topping  (or the absence of it) meant... Got that removed...hurrah!  Paid quickly left no tip...won't come back...  Conclusion: that happens when you hire a waitress who's not a waitress with almost zero grasp of the  basics of English language....what a shame...it used to be a very good place to eat...

photos.caption: Photo of La Favorita - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of La Favorita - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of La Favorita - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

bcI2aIMu7k8i-jvRh8bhjA.text: Love love love. Authentic homely Italian food. Extremely friendly and lovely staff and they made the the whole experience so much better. The food was just fantastic and we wiped every plate clean.   We were really hungry so we skipped the starters and went straight for the mains. Ordered the risotto, chicken Milanese and asparagus and ricotta tortellini. Every single dish was delicious and would definitely go back here.   For dessert order the tiramisu and the gnocchi chocolate. Yum!

photos.caption: Photo of La Favorita - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Tiramisu
Photo of La Favorita - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Gnocchi chocolate
Photo of La Favorita - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Gnocchi chocolate

U3Rj9LI7JK5OY4sarkTaIg.text: This review is for La Favorita's take away service, which I don't recommend. As a heads up, to start with, their takeaway menu is different from the one you find on the restaurant's main website. Overall pros: super friendly service, decent prices, was ready for pick up quickly, and the food was clearly freshly made. Main con: the food itself was really mediocre, I've had way better Italian food for the same price. Our pizza was a bit dried out and had very sparse toppings. The tagliatelle and gnocchi we got were just okay - the gnocchi was bland and the texture of the tagliatelle was a little off-putting. Based on the consistent good reviews I'm guessing the restaurant experience is better than the take away, so go for that if you're wanting to try this place out.

ngaIZXYL0vIgz-nldFbY2w.text: Great pizza. Great kids meals. My son loved the breaded chicken strips. Pizza was light and fresh tasting. Great atmosphere for couples or families.

5GAx4KzY-jT7Jw2GmzkoSA.text: Our expectations were high with this restaurant coming in as the highest placed Scottish restaurant in Yelp's recent top 100 UK eateries list. The vibe is casual and welcoming and the staff friendly and professional. The menu is quite large and overwhelming so it took us a while to figure out what we wanted to order. My Fucco e Fumo pizza was good - the base was nice and crisp, but I expected my 'fire and smoke' pizza to pack more of a punch flavour-wise. There's a good selection of wine, spirits and classic cocktails but the beer choice is a bit limited. For dessert the dark chocolate gnocchi piqued my interest however I was too full of pizza for that so I opted for ice-cream. The ice-cream is amazing! I'd definitely recommend saving space for a few scoops at the end of your meal! I tried the chocolate, pistachio and amaretto flavours and they were so good, particularly the amaretto!

photos.caption: Photo of La Favorita - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of La Favorita - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

3zzvivRe0Z_1C4RX-0c9HA.text: La Favorita has been a long favourite amongst Edinburgers for Italian food.  This establishment specialises mainly in pizzas.  They have been voted best pizza in a few award in Scotland.  I have been eating in this establishment for 10 years as I stay literally 2 minutes away.  I need to be honest and say that the pizza quality 10 years ago compared to now has certainly dropped.  I am unsure if its due to the fact that they have opened a delivery / takeway for pizza or if they have changed the chef but I certainly was disappointed with the pizza.  However, today I am reviewing a non-pizza dish.  It is the Branzino Al Forno which is a whole seabass.  If you look at the picture, the seabass is adequately sized for a portion.  Skin was definitely crispy when served and I am the kind of guy who loves skin.  Why waste?  For me, the fish was properly seasoned and the sides which came with it complements the fish and definitely brings out the flavour of the sea bass.  Only one thing I have to comment was that the fish was a bit slightly overcooked.  Not a lot but just a tad bit.  That said, dish was still great.  Would always come back here as its one of my local Italian joint with hearty meal and great staff.

photos.caption: Photo of La Favorita - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

3gM69YHhLBE5_5eMR8J-UQ.text: La Favorita was highly rated and listed in Edinburgh's top 10 places to eat. We only had the pizza and requested our own toppings - onion, mushroom and 1/2 Parma ham, 1/2 spicy salami. They automatically split in half for serving which was perfect.  This place did not disappoint.  Service was great and server was attentive.  They also have a nice outdoor space for dining which is perfect when the sun is shining.   Would absolutely eat here again.

photos.caption: Photo of La Favorita - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. 14&#34; onion, mushroom, half Parma ham
Photo of La Favorita - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Delicious!  Half Parma ham, half spicy salami - they serve already split

eAJu0l563fKXLLC-2nTduA.text: Deliciosa! This place sports a great atmosphere and friendly staff, and serves you up an amazingly good classic Italian style pizza. It was our final stop in Scotland before we headed out to the airport, and a place which, if I were living in Edinburgh, would definitely be one my "Favorita's" for a good pizza.  Altamente raccomandato!

5NVEINAAe1B4WEdBMPo9_Q.text: Went here when my mom came for a visit. Tasty pizza, big, thin crust. We both got the aubergine one. It was good but not amazing, a little bit bland. It was very busy and our table (all the way in the back) was quite wobbly and super close to the next table. There was no way to move out comfortably at all, especially with coats and bag. Also I had no knife on my table, so took one from the table next to me. so then they had no knife :) Because of course the waitress was so busy, it was hard to flag her down. Super friendly though! Liked the interior, bit too crowded for me, just everything too close together, made me enjoy my meal a bit less. Wouldn't mind trying it again but just can't give more than three stars based on my visit.

QCVUp_dC5X1O31MkWgpozA.text: Their lunch special (before 5) offers a main and drink, a main& starter and drink, a main& starter& dessert and drink, all for slightly increasing prices. The selection has a bit of everything Italian, all their famed pastas and pizzas, at cheaper prices. We went at 4pm for a very late lunch, late enough that people were crossing the street hearing our bellies grumble- I don't know if they were worried we would turn cannibal, or if the rumbling sound was offsetting their deep vacant thoughts. At last, we got a seat and the food was not long in arriving. The Italian server added pepper and cheese, and we dove in.  I had pizza, which was thin and crispy, with fresh veggies, and so large I didn't even eat half. Luckily my companions were more willing to stuff themselves, even after also comsuming an

photos.caption: Photo of La Favorita - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Italian beer

chn2BUIDbAPVjrTiLxlh5g.text: Much better than I expected!  Very family friendly and good service. Ordered pasta and some starters,  and finished off with some grape ice cream that didn't end up being top sweet.  Was impressed by the customer service and had a large table to accommodate a group larger than 5 plus kids.

photos.caption: Photo of La Favorita - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of La Favorita - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of La Favorita - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

64u91EC_cw4ZsSmL1FSG8w.text: The customer service is great and Professional but it stops there.   The party of 3 me and my 2 ladies orders  a Cecar Sallad garlic bread and I ordered one of the simplest pizzas there is. Hawaii   The Cesar sallad was ambitious fresh by lacks the second word in the dish.  sallad   The pizza was taste less.  No pineapple taste in the pineapple just sugary water.  That is disappointing.  It does not help to have fancy combinations for the pizzas if you can't get the simplest pizza tasteful.   Sorry great people but disappointing food

RPkdbjXQiBNqYtTNtPgR3w.text: They did a wonderful job welcoming our large group into their restaurant and the service was very good and attentive. We came here via a friends recommendation and most people really enjoyed it. The pizza is supposed to be their thing and although it was good it didn't knock my socks off. But what did see is everyone enjoying ourselves and the wine kept flowing. I would go back and try some of their other options.

ekInguvhDwTpxrlPGDNngQ.text: An off-shoot of the wonderful Vittoria just up the road this great pizza restaurant is where the old Caprice was - great atmosphere, fantastic pizza (proper wood fired pizza oven), great for groups and very stylish to boot.

lr1osKzyfPPm0AcfE78T1w.text: Modern Italian restaurant that doesn't quite live up to the hype.   The pizza is of generally good quality and they're able to cater for dietary requirements such as gluten free that would rule out many an Italian restaurant.   That said, it wouldn't be my first choice as the prices are relatively steep and decor can make the place feel a bit clinical.   Takeaway is expensive & many of the topping combinations don't travel well.

jdfeTDUQl4_4gmwffGV-Sg.text: Sister restaurant of Vittoria's up the street. Offering a great selection of pizzas and pastas, not forgetting the delicious desserts, at prices representing good value for money.

loc07ODBzNILkOH0KGRcQg.text: Great big pizzas and efficient service. Not expensive either- around a tenner for a pizza. Our starters were big too. All in all value for money. Does what it says on the tin.

T32XwusN6m7YJtGa6Q65Qg.text: nice meals a great change from pizza hut

SPn9q-_kCsvuXRWnpojodQ.text: This newish Italian Resteraunt on Leith Walk is fantastic. From great pizza, different pasta to heavenly desserts, take your pick. Mine is the Vesuvio Pizza or the Fagottini alla polpa di scampi always finished off with Tiramisu. All at a pretty good price! My special place in Edinburgh!

ATxvA9ZvFW1CEi-X8lNdxQ.text: La Favorita and its sister restaurant Vittoria's up the road are the best restaurants on Leith Walk and probably 2 of the best Italian restaurants in Edinburgh. La Favorita has a proper wood fired pizza oven which means the pizzas taste exactly like the do in Italy. They have a massive choice of toppings which will suit everyone's tastes. The pasta and risotto choices are also very tasty although the pizzas are the main draw. The food is always freshly prepared, tasty and reasonably priced. It serves very authentic Italian dishes wih more unusual dishes than the standard lasagne and carbonara that many Italians serve. The restaurant is also family friendly and caters for allergies with gluten free pasta on request.

LdtTdY4uWvwigpQZr1Aejg.text: Awesome pizza, tastes like it does in Italy.

HBtCaO61Xl5qF5rJu8R57Q.text: The best pizza I've tried in Scotland. A little on the expensive side, but worth it.

R_uvXQRsN7amU6luvu_s-A.text: La Favorita is probably one of the best restaurants in Edinburgh to visit with a group of friends, or even just as a couple. The food is always really good - lovely pizzas with nice crispy thin bases, and a fairly extensive menu overall. The staff are generally very friendly and add to the genuine Italian feel of the restaurant. Being half way down Leith Walk it is a little away from the other main eateries or bars in the city but you can always stop in one of the many Leith Walk bars most of which have unique characters of their own. I would particularly recommend Boda alittle further down!

wJ44JSgo5a0TjGoNUQE36Q.text: La Favorita is an ultra-modern Italian restaurant, offering a refreshing take on many Italian favourites. The service from the staff here is the best I have experienced anywhere, and the prices range from reasonable to only slightly expensive. My favourite Edinburgh restaurant!
